title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: The most secretive recipe at Hope’s Corner
text:
The most secretive recipe at Hope’s Corner
Miguel’s famous mole recipe

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Miguel writes his recipe in this book
text: Miguel writes his recipe in this book

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Every change being made is tracked on a separate page
text:
Every change being made is tracked on a separate page
This is the concept of version control. Every change is a commit.

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: The recipe to be used is bookmarked.
text:
The recipe to be used is bookmarked.


This is the concept of a release.

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: If Caleb wants to tweak the recipe, he will make a copy of the recipe and make his changes there.
text:
If Caleb wants to tweak the recipe, he will make a copy of the recipe and make his changes there.


This is the concept of a branch.

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: If that recipe turns out to be better, Miguel can merge Caleb’s changes into the original recipe.
text:
If that recipe turns out to be better, Miguel can merge Caleb’s changes into the original recipe.

This is the concept of a pull request.

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: How do these concepts fit to the Hope’s Corner App?
text:
How do these concepts fit to the Hope’s Corner App?


We store the recipe (code) in GitHub.

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: How do people eat the recipe?
text:
How do people eat the recipe?

We need to cook the food (deploy the code) so that people can eat (use the app).
We deploy the app to Vercel

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Where do we store all the data?
text:
Where do we store all the data?

Like an order log of people who ate the mole, we store all the data in a database called Supabase.

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: So where is the code stored on GitHub?
text:
So where is the code stored on GitHub?

Code is stored over here


The code is publicly available, the data is not.

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: How do we make changes to the code?
text:
How do we make changes to the code?
Create an issue on GitHub and select Feature Request.

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Add all details about the change you want to make in the feature request
text: Add all details about the change you want to make in the feature request

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Assign the issue to Copilot
text: Assign the issue to Copilot

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Watch TikTok for 10 minutes while Copilot works
text: Watch TikTok for 10 minutes while Copilot works

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Verify the changes on staging deployment
text: Verify the changes on staging deployment

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Mark the pull request as ready for review
text: Mark the pull request as ready for review

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Make sure its green all the way through
text: Make sure its green all the way through

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Merge the pull request
text: Merge the pull request

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Celebrate the new feature you just added to the app!
text: Celebrate the new feature you just added to the app!

title: Hope’s Corner App Training
section: Questions?
text:
Questions?
If none, we will start with a hands-on session.
